Statement of compliance.summary: All required documentation appears to be present for review. The organisation has declared current non-compliance with multiple General Conditions (A4, A6, D2, D4) and Qualification Conditions (E2, E7) relating to assessment security, storage protocols, and candidate identity verification during remote assessments. Special Condition SC-2025-APU-01 requires enhanced verification procedures by 30 September 2025. The organisation also anticipates future non-compliance with AI-assisted assessment requirements expected in 2026, with a comprehensive remediation plan and external consultancy support documented.
keyConcerns: Non-compliance with assessment security protocols (Conditions A4, A6, D2, D4)

Recognition application.summary: All required documentation appears to be present for review. The organisation seeks recognition for EPAs in software development (levels 3-4), software testing and business analysis (level 4), plus vocational qualifications in software development and network infrastructure. The application provides substantial evidence across all criteria sections with comprehensive narrative responses and extensive supporting documentation appropriate for detailed assessment against recognition requirements.
